context: Question: The warehouse worker pushed the box cart faster on the warehouse cement floor than on the rug because it had (A) more resistance (B) less resistance
target: The answer is A because the question states that the worker pushed the cart faster on the cement floor than on the rug, indicating that there is more resistance on the rug. context: Question: Mark drives down 1st Street and it is very bumpy so his car is slow. Then Mark drives down 2nd Street and his car goes fast. This is because 2nd street has (A) more resistance (B) less resistance.
target: The answer is B because the question states that Mark's car goes faster on 2nd street than on 1st street. This means that there is less resistance on 2nd street, allowing Mark's car to move faster.

context: Question: As the spaceship flew closer to the sun it grew (A) brighter (B) dimmer
target: The answer is A because the sun emits light, and as the spaceship gets closer to the sun, it receives more direct sunlight, making the spaceship appear brighter.

context: Question: A ticket slid across a floor mat makes it heat up more than sliding it across a dashboard. This means the _____ has less friction (A) dashboard (B) floor mat
target: The answer is A because the question states that the ticket slides more easily and heats up less when it is slid across the dashboard compared to the floor mat. This indicates that the dashboard has less friction, allowing the ticket to slide more easily and generate less friction, which causes less heat.

context: Question: A beetle experiences low resistance walking around in a shoebox and high resistance walking around on a carpet. This means the beetle gets hotter walking around on the (A) shoebox (B) carpet
target: The answer is B because resistance to motion causes energy to be lost as heat. Since the beetle experiences high resistance when walking on the carpet compared to the shoebox, more energy is lost to friction and heat is produced, causing the beetle to get hotter.

context: Question: Matt discovered that clouds are not as rough as rain when he flew his kite through both. His kite warmed up less in the (A) clouds (B) rain

context: Question: A group of kids are playing in the snow on a winter day. They roll up some snow into a huge snowball and roll up some snow into a smaller snowball that is about half the size of the larger snowball. Some of the kids push the huge snowball and some of them push the smaller snowball. Which snowball will take longer to get up to a fast speed? (A) smaller snowball (B) huge snowball
target: The answer is B because it takes more effort to push a larger object than a smaller one, meaning it will take longer for the kids to get the huge snowball up to a fast speed compared to the smaller snowball.

context: Question: Bob likes to skip rocks across the lake. He skipped rocks on a calm day when the lake was smooth and on a windy day when the lake was choppy. He noticed that the rock encountered less friction on the smooth lake than the choppy lake. Which lake would the rock skip farther on? (A) The smooth lake (B) The choppy lake
target: The answer is A because the question states that the rock encountered less friction on the smooth lake than the choppy lake, and less friction allows the rock to travel farther when skipped.

context: Question: The ranger and the rustler both were riding horses that galloped at the same speed.  The rustler left an hour before the ranger.  Who has traveled further? (A) the ranger (B) the rustler
target: The answer is B because the rustler left an hour earlier and was traveling at the same speed as the ranger, allowing him to have covered more distance over the same period of time.

context: Question: Jason is sitting on Johns back as he does pushups. Who is sweating more in this situation? (A) Jason (B) John

context: Question: The planet Earth has more mass then the plant Venus. Which plant has stronger gravity emitting from it? (A) Earth (B) Venus
target: The answer is A. While the question may appear to be misleading due to the use of the word "plant," it is actually referring to the planets Earth and Venus. The question states that Earth has more mass than Venus, so Earth has a stronger gravitational force.

context: Question: Both Mary and Jimbo were out working in a field digging a hole. Mary was working very hard, while Jimbo was just standing around leaning on his shovel. Which person was producing more sweat? (A) Mary (B) Jimbo
target: The answer is A because Mary is working very hard and the sweat production is a natural response to physical exertion. Jimbo is only leaning on his shovel and not working, so he is not producing as much sweat.

context: Question: Jim was fishing by the river when he noticed a cute bunny rabbit.  He also noticed a crocodile.  Just then, the rabbit did, too. It started bolting.
